result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Ryan P Rezin was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Ryan P Rezin was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Revoked (Misdemeanor)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The fine is $2452.00 to be paid as condition of probation.

DNA surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as condition of probation.

State blood draw of $87.00 to be paid as condition of probation.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submitt DNA sample.

Defendant Ryan P Rezin in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Cts. 1 & 2.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Ct. 3 Dismissed.  On Ct. 2 Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 months in jail, with Huber work release, consecutive to sentence he is currently serving.  $243.00 costs.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  Ct. 1 Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 3 years.  Conditions of probation include: AODA and comply.  6 months jail, with Huber work release, consecutive to Ct. 2. $2452.00 fines and costs. $87.00 blood draw fee.  Submit DNA sample.  $250.00 DNA surcharge.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  36 month DL revocation and 36 month IID upon licensure.  16TR225 and 16TR226 Dismissed.  No credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 19, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
